CatDescriptText: Mr. James Embry, Chauncey Street and Wylie Avenue, and Mr. Jack Mager, 408 Sloan Street, McKees Rocks, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1, with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" Mr. James Embry's answer reads: "No, and one reason is there is too much notoriety, too many risks, and too filthy a job for women, in fact, the way I look at it, if a woman has to go into a bar just as a customer, let her take a table and booth and be seated and served." Mr. Jack Mager's answer reads: "Absolutely not, and mainly because a guy who goes to the bar likes to talk men's talk. With women around, you can't talk as you would like to without offending the women."
TitMainTitle: Jack Mager and James Embry holding books and standing on Liberty Avenue, Downtown
